I certainly respect all these actors though.

@BenMank77 The Treasure of the Sierra Madre!
@KevinMKruse PTA once said he thought Treasure of the Sierra Madre was the best movie he ever saw....I'm not gonna disagree

@alexcowan2 1) The Ox-Bow Incident (book is also excellent)
2) The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
3) Treasure of the Sierra Madre.

For comedy Westerns: Support Your Local Sheriff, McLintock!, Blazing Saddles

@alexcowan2 My favorites are Magnificent Seven (1960), Treasure of the Sierra Madre (1948), & Tombstone (1993). I'd also recommend Shane, True Grit (1969 gets you some John Wayne, but 2010's is excellent too), Once Upon a Time in the West, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, & Unforgiven.
I watched the treasure of Sierra madre long back only fr bogart so don’t rmbr much.
@therealaaronk Would The Treasure of the Sierra Madre count Bc if so watch that too

@RaggedTP 'The Treasure of the Sierra Madre'. Classic John Houston and Humphry Bogart epic written by mysterious communist Ben Travern. Often imitated but never bettered, this is simply the best yarn about how money corrupts. Genuinely brilliant Oscar winner, sadly under-appreciated.
@RaggedTP The Treasure Of The Sierra Madre
@RaggedTP Treasure of the Sierra Madre

My favorite films - 1948 (Updated).

1. Treasure Of The Sierra Madre
2. Rope
3. Key Largo
4. He Walked By Night
5. The Naked City
6. Cry Of The City
Treasure Of The Sierra Madre Ending Explained: Can Gold Change A Man's Soul? https://t.co/Yt3eQaJpky #Movies https://t.co/KRpncTvx6M

@alexcowan2 Red River, Little Big Man or Jeremiah Johnson & the best is- Treasure of the Sierra Madre, as it’s unique. Comedy one is Butch Cassidy & the Sundance Kid, spaghetti westerns are great & lastly there’s something wonderful about the scenes in Monument Valley. Great genre.

@StikyIckyRicky in no particular order (except #1), 5 of my favorites that do fall under that pre-74 category, we got The Godfather(#1); The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly; Casablanca; 7 Samurai; The Treasure of The Sierra Madre
